sourcesContent:
/* take in JSON packages which will then be converted to props pass down those props to a render table function or class. This render table function look for the state of the dropdown. when no state is chosen, show total score. When an option in the dropdown is chosen, switch the state and render those elements category can be deleted from the table, and the webpage can just say "TOP 10 leaders in "category" personal stats should be a separate row at the top learn how to take in a JSON package import React, {Component} from 'react' import './App.css' import Table from 'react-bootstrap/Table' import { Dropdown, DropdownToggle, DropdownMenu, DropdownItem, DropdownButton} from 'react-bootstrap'; import 'bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css' // for the minimal css for table and buttons const App = () => { const leader = [ {name: "this guy", category: "Intro to C", score: 10, percentage: ""}, {name: "person", category: "Intro to C", score: 6, percentage: ""}, {name: "dude", category: "Intro to C", score: 2, percentage: ""}, {name: "someone", category: "Intro to C", score: 4, percentage: ""} ] leader.sort((a, b) => (a.score < b.score) ? 1 : -1) const renderTable = (leader, index) => { const bool1 = 12; const bool2 = 32; return( {++index} {leader.name} {leader.category} {leader.score} {leader.percentage} ) } return (

Trivia Crevice

Intro to C CSI CSII

Leaderboards

{leader.map(renderTable)}
Rank Name Category Score Percentage
) } export default App; */ import React, {Component} from 'react' import './App.css' import Table from 'react-bootstrap/Table' import RenderPersonalStats from './RenderPersonalStats' import { Dropdown, DropdownToggle, DropdownMenu, DropdownItem, DropdownButton} from 'react-bootstrap'; import 'bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css' // for the minimal css for table and buttons export default class App extends Component { constructor(props) { super(props) this.state = { leaders: [ {name: "this guy", category: "Intro to C", score: 10, percentage: ""}, {name: "person", category: "Intro to C", score: 6, percentage: ""}, {name: "dude", category: "Intro to C", score: 2, percentage: ""}, {name: "someone", category: "Intro to C", score: 4, percentage: ""} ] } } render() { return(

Trivia Crevice

Leaderboards

) } }
